data.title: Jerome Lemelin
data.meta_description: SOMERSWORTH — Jerome Lemelin, 65, of 11 Chabot St., died Tuesday, Jan. 9, 2007, at his home after a long illness. \n He was born in Somersworth on Nov. 5, 1941, and was the son of Joseph and Grace (De…
data.text:
SOMERSWORTH — Jerome Lemelin, 65, of 11 Chabot St., died Tuesday, Jan. 9, 2007, at his home after a long illness.

He was born in Somersworth on Nov. 5, 1941, and was the son of Joseph and Grace (Deschenes) Lemelin. He was raised in this community, attending St. Martin Academy and graduating from Somersworth High School, Class of 1941. He was a lifelong resident of Somersworth.

He was a veteran of the U.S. Air Force, serving four years during peacetime. After his military service, he went on to a career with the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard, where he served as head of Information Systems. He retired in 1997 after 37 years of service.

Active in the community, he served as a volunteer with the Somersworth Library and was a former chairman of the Library Trustees.

Family members include his children, Michele Lemelin and her husband, Norman Smith of Jasper, Ind., Paul Lemelin and Timothy Lemelin and his wife, Jeanne, all of Somersworth and JoAnne Vaillancourt and her husband, Michael, of Rochester. He also leaves his grandchildren, Cameron, Christian, Marissa, Alec, and Louise. Other family members include his brothers, Raymond Lemelin of Center Strafford, Normand Lemelin of Somersworth, Roger Lemelin of Barrington, Robert Lemelin of Chester and his sister, Pauline Lemelin of Northwood; many nephews, nieces and cousins.

He was predeceased by his wife, Louisette (Louise) Lemelin, who died in 1999.

————

A memorial Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated on Saturday at 10 a.m. in St. Martin Catholic Church, W. High and Maple Street, Somersworth, with the Rev. Aaron Pfaff, pastor, as celebrant. Burial will follow in Mt. Calvary Cemetery, Somersworth.

The family respectfully declines flowers and request that memorial contributions be made to either the American Cancer Society or to the Somersworth Library. Folders will be available at the service.

To view and sign the online guest book please visit, www.bernierfuneralhome.com

The Bernier Funeral Home, 49 South St., Somersworth, N.H., has been entrusted with funeral arrangements.
